intro: Erigeron stocksianus, commonly known as the California blueweed, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and disturbed soils. It features narrow, gray-green leaves and produces small blue to purple flowers in late summer. Erigeron stocksianus is often used in xeriscaping due to its drought tolerance and ornamental value.
